I just had this exact same problem. I had to use the above advice and found my libcuda directory with this lost shared object, and in my case I ran:

export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64/

...and then everything worked for me when I ran my Tensorflow script in python3.6 . This was with cuda-8.0 however -- I was pointing to a symlink for my environment variable.

body:
I just had this exact same problem. I had to use the above advice and found my libcuda directory with this lost shared object, and in my case I ran:

```bash
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64/
```

...and then everything worked for me when I ran my Tensorflow script in `python3.6` . This was with  `cuda-8.0` however -- I was pointing to a symlink for my environment variable.
